encodingUse: Each character is one to four 8-bit code units. Each 8-bit code unit is a byte. Primary character set used on internet.

Each character is one or two 16-bit code units. Not really used. Characters that are preceded by the character defined by the 0xC2 UTF-16 base 16 character identifier when the UTF-8 base 16 character identifiers are decomposed to UTF-16 base 16 character identifiers. Seeing the 0xC2 UTF-16 base 16 character identifier in data using the UTF-16 character set where it is not expected is a sign that UTF-8 to UTF-16 decomposition has taken place.

note: CP1252 is a character set and an encoding
ASCII is a character set and an encoding.
HTML 5 uses UTF-8 by default (not fully though)
